place.name: SOUTH CARLTON
place.gazetteerText: CARLTON (South), a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; 3¼ miles E of Saxelby r. station, and 4 NNW of Lincoln. Post Town, Lincoln. Acres, 1,910. Real property, £2,282. Pop., 181. Houses, 32. The property is divided between two. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £200. Patron, the Bishop of Lincoln. The church is tolerable. Admirable Sir W. Monson, of the time of Elizabeth, was a native. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
